representedCustodianOrganization.name: Kaiser Permanente Santa Clara Medical Center - Homestead Campus

section.title: History of Present Illness
section.text:
Henry Levin, the 7 th
is a 67 year old male referred for further asthma management. Onset of asthma in his twenties teens . He was hospitalized twice last year, and already twice this year. He has not been able to be weaned off steroids for the past several months.

list.item: Father had fatal MI in his early 50's.
Smoking :: 1 PPD between the ages of 20 and 55, and then he quit.

targetSiteCode.displayName: Skin of palmer surface of index finger

section.text:
1430
Skin Exam
Erythematous rash, palmar surface, left index finger.
Lungs

effectiveTime.value: Clear with no wheeze. Good air flow.

section.title: Cardiac
section.text:
RRR with no murmur, no S3, no S4.
Labs
CXR 02/03/1999: Hyperinflated. Normal cardiac silhouette, clear lungs.
Peak Flow today: 260 l/m

targetSiteCode.displayName: Skin of palmer surface of index finger

section.text:
Suture removal, left forearm.
20010104
1330 Assessment
Asthma, with prior smoking history. Difficulty weaning off steroids. Will try gradual taper.
Hypertension, well-controlled.
Contact dermatitis on finger.
